intro: Caryophyllata rivalis, commonly known as the Crimson Flame Snapdragon, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It belongs to the Plantaginaceae family and is characterized by its vibrant red, tubular flowers that attract pollinators such as bees and butterflies. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, featuring upright stems and narrow, lance-shaped leaves. It thrives in well-drained soil and full sun, making it a popular choice for rock gardens and borders. Its botanical features include showy inflorescences and a short growing season, usually blooming from late spring to early summer.
